2301420.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301420
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 001
2301420.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "No Muslim who has had three of his children die young will enter the Fire, except to expiate an unfulfilled oath."

2301430.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301430
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 002
2301430.text: Abu Hurayra reported that a woman came to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, with a child. She said, "Make supplication for him. I have buried three children." He said, "You have built a strong barrier against the Fire."

2301440.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301440
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 003
2301440.text: Khalid al-'Absi said, "A son of mine died and I felt intense grief over his loss. I said, 'Abu Hurayra, have you heard anything from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, to cheer us regarding our dead?' He replied, 'I heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "Your children are roaming freely in the Garden."'"

2301450.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301450
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 004
2301450.text: Jabir ibn 'Abdullah said, "I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, 'If anyone has three of his children die young and resigns them to Allah, he will enter the Garden.' We said, 'Messenger of Allah, what about two?' 'And two,' he said." Mahmud ibn Labid said to Jabir, "By Allah, I think that if you had asked, 'And one?' he would have given a similar answer." He said, "By Allah, I think so too."

2301470.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301470
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 006
2301470.text: Abu Hurayra reported, "A woman came to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said, 'Messenger of Allah! We cannot come to sit with you, so set aside a day when we can come.' He said, 'Your appointed place is the house of so-and-so.' He came to the women at that time. Part of what he said to them was, 'There is no woman among you who has three children die, resigning them to Allah, who will not enter the Garden.' A woman said, 'And if it is two?' He replied, 'And if it is two.'"

2301480.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301480
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 007
2301480.text: Umm Salim said, "While I was with the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, he said, 'Umm Salim! There is no Muslim couple who have three of their children die without Allah admitting them to the Garden by virtue of His mercy to them.' I said, 'And if there are two?' He said, 'And if there are two.'"

2301490.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301490
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 008
2301490.text: Al-Hasan reported that Sa'sa'a ibn Mu'awiya told him that he met Abu Dharr finding him alone without any relatives and asked, "Don't you have any children, Abu Dharr?" He said, "I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, 'There is no Muslim who has three of his children die before they reach puberty without Allah admitting him to the Garden by virtue of His mercy to them. There is no man who frees a Muslim with Allah Almighty making each of the limbs of the one who is freed a ransom for each of the emancipator's limbs.'"

2301500.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301500
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 009
2301500.text: Anas ibn Malik reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "If someone has three children die before they reach puberty, Allah will admit him and them to the Garden by virtue of His mercy."

2301510.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301510
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 010
2301510.text: Sahl ibn al-Hanzala, who had no children, said, "I would prefer to have a miscarried child while I am a Muslim and resign that child to Allah than to have the entire world and what it contains."

2301520.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301520
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 011
2301520.text: 'Abdullah reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Which of you prefers the money of heirs to his own money?" "Messenger of Allah," they replied, "there is none of us who does not prefer his own wealth to that of his heirs." The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Know that there is not one of you who does not prefer his heirs' money to his own. Your wealth is what you have spent (for Allah) and the wealth of your heirs is what you leave."

2301530.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301530
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 012
2301530.text: He said that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Who do you reckon to be the childless among you?" They said, "They are those who do not have any children." No," he said, "The childless are those who have not sent any of their children ahead (i.e. none of their children have died)."

2301540.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301540
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 013
2301540.text: He reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Who do you reckon to be the one who most often throws people down (in a fight)?" They replied, "The one whom men do not throw down." He said, "No the one who throws people down is the person who controls himself when he is angry."
